intro: Pentacalia hurtadoi, commonly known as the Hurtado's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
